Default LE create connection parameters. Scan continuously by setting scan interval equal to scan window.
Default LE create connection using filter accept list parameters. Scan window: 30 ms. Scan interval: 60 ms.

briefdescription.para: Register a callback structure for connection events.

briefdescription.para: Enable LE Coded PHY.

para.verbatim: Enable scanning on the LE Coded PHY.

briefdescription.para: Disable LE 1M PHY.

para.verbatim:
Disable scanning on the LE 1M PHY.
@note Requires @ref BT_CONN_LE_OPT_CODED.

detaileddescription.para: Level 0: Only for BR/EDR special cases, like SDP
Level 1: No encryption and no authentication.
Level 2: Encryption and no authentication (no MITM).
Level 3: Encryption and authentication (MITM).
Level 4: Authenticated Secure Connections and 128-bit key.
Bit to force new pairing procedure, bit-wise OR with requested security level.
Security level.
Security procedure successful.
Authentication failed.
PIN or encryption key is missing.
OOB data is not available.
The requested security level could not be reached.
Pairing is not supported
Pairing is not allowed.
Invalid parameters.
Distributed Key Rejected
Pairing failed but the exact reason could not be specified.

briefdescription.para: Increment a connection's reference count.

detaileddescription.para: Increment the reference count of a connection object.

simplesect.para: Will return NULL if the reference count is zero.
Connection object with incremented reference count, or NULL if the reference count is zero.

briefdescription.para: Decrement a connection's reference count.

detaileddescription.para: Decrement the reference count of a connection object.

briefdescription.para: Iterate through all existing connections.

parameterdescription.para: Function to call for each connection.
Data to pass to the callback function.

briefdescription.para: Look up an existing connection by address.

detaileddescription.para: Look up an existing connection based on the remote address.
The caller gets a new reference to the connection object which must be released with bt_conn_unref() once done using the object.

simplesect.para: Connection object or NULL if not found.

briefdescription.para: Get destination (peer) address of a connection.

simplesect.para: Destination address.

briefdescription.para: Get array index of a connection.

detaileddescription.para: This function is used to map bt_conn to index of an array of connections. The array has CONFIG_BT_MAX_CONN elements.

simplesect.para: Index of the connection object. The range of the returned value is 0..CONFIG_BT_MAX_CONN-1

briefdescription.para: Get connection info.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code on failure.

briefdescription.para: Get connection info for the remote device.

simplesect.para: In order to retrieve the remote version (version, manufacturer and subversion) embed:rst:inline :kconfig:`CONFIG_BT_REMOTE_VERSION` must be enabled

The remote information is exchanged directly after the connection has been established. The application can be notified about when the remote information is available through the remote_info_available callback.
Zero on success or (negative) error code on failure.
-EBUSY The remote information is not yet available.

briefdescription.para: Get connection transmit power level.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code on failure.
-ENOBUFS HCI command buffer is not available.

briefdescription.para: Update the connection parameters.

detaileddescription.para: If the local device is in the peripheral role then updating the connection parameters will be delayed. This delay can be configured by through the embed:rst:inline :kconfig:`CONFIG_BT_CONN_PARAM_UPDATE_TIMEOUT` option.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code on failure.

briefdescription.para: Update the connection transmit data length parameters.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code on failure.

briefdescription.para: Update the connection PHY parameters.

detaileddescription.para: Update the preferred transmit and receive PHYs of the connection. Use BT_GAP_LE_PHY_NONE to indicate no preference.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code on failure.

briefdescription.para: Disconnect from a remote device or cancel pending connection.

detaileddescription.para: Disconnect an active connection with the specified reason code or cancel pending outgoing connection.
The disconnect reason for a normal disconnect should be: BT_HCI_ERR_REMOTE_USER_TERM_CONN.

The following disconnect reasons are accepted:
BT_HCI_ERR_AUTH_FAIL
BT_HCI_ERR_REMOTE_USER_TERM_CONN
BT_HCI_ERR_REMOTE_LOW_RESOURCES
BT_HCI_ERR_REMOTE_POWER_OFF
BT_HCI_ERR_UNSUPP_REMOTE_FEATURE
BT_HCI_ERR_PAIRING_NOT_SUPPORTED
BT_HCI_ERR_UNACCEPT_CONN_PARAM

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code on failure.

memberdef.argsstring: (const bt_addr_le_t *peer, const struct bt_conn_le_create_param *create_param, const struct bt_le_conn_param *conn_param, struct bt_conn **conn)
memberdef.name: bt_conn_le_create

briefdescription.para: Initiate an LE connection to a remote device.

detaileddescription.para: Allows initiate new LE link to remote peer using its address.
The caller gets a new reference to the connection object which must be released with bt_conn_unref() once done using the object.
This uses the General Connection Establishment procedure.
The application must disable explicit scanning before initiating a new LE connection.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code on failure.

briefdescription.para: Automatically connect to remote devices in the filter accept list..

detaileddescription.para: This uses the Auto Connection Establishment procedure. The procedure will continue until a single connection is established or the procedure is stopped through bt_conn_create_auto_stop. To establish connections to all devices in the the filter accept list the procedure should be started again in the connected callback after a new connection has been established.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code on failure.
-ENOMEM No free connection object available.

briefdescription.para: Stop automatic connect creation.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code on failure.

briefdescription.para: Automatically connect to remote device if it's in range.

detaileddescription.para: This function enables/disables automatic connection initiation. Every time the device loses the connection with peer, this connection will be re-established if connectable advertisement from peer is received.

simplesect.para: Auto connect is disabled during explicit scanning.

parameterdescription.para: If non-NULL, auto connect is enabled with the given parameters. If NULL, auto connect is disabled.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or error code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Set security level for a connection.

detaileddescription.para: This function enable security (encryption) for a connection. If the device has bond information for the peer with sufficiently strong key encryption will be enabled. If the connection is already encrypted with sufficiently strong key this function does nothing.

If the device has no bond information for the peer and is not already paired then the pairing procedure will be initiated. If the device has bond information or is already paired and the keys are too weak then the pairing procedure will be initiated.

This function may return error if required level of security is not possible to achieve due to local or remote device limitation (e.g., input output capabilities), or if the maximum number of paired devices has been reached.
This function may return error if the pairing procedure has already been initiated by the local device or the peer device.

simplesect.para: When embed:rst:inline :kconfig:`CONFIG_BT_SMP_SC_ONLY` is enabled then the security level will always be level 4.
When embed:rst:inline :kconfig:`CONFIG_BT_SMP_OOB_LEGACY_PAIR_ONLY` is enabled then the security level will always be level 3.
0 on success or negative error

briefdescription.para: Get security level for a connection.

simplesect.para: Connection security level

briefdescription.para: Get encryption key size.

detaileddescription.para: This function gets encryption key size. If there is no security (encryption) enabled 0 will be returned.

simplesect.para: Encryption key size.

briefdescription.para: Register connection callbacks.

detaileddescription.para: Register callbacks to monitor the state of connections.

parameterdescription.para: Callback struct. Must point to memory that remains valid.

briefdescription.para: Enable/disable bonding.

detaileddescription.para: Set/clear the Bonding flag in the Authentication Requirements of SMP Pairing Request/Response data. The initial value of this flag depends on BT_BONDABLE Kconfig setting. For the vast majority of applications calling this function shouldn't be needed.

briefdescription.para: Allow/disallow remote OOB data to be used for pairing.

detaileddescription.para: Set/clear the OOB data flag for SMP Pairing Request/Response data. The initial value of this flag depends on BT_OOB_DATA_PRESENT Kconfig setting.

briefdescription.para: Set OOB Temporary Key to be used for pairing.

detaileddescription.para: This function allows to set OOB data for the LE legacy pairing procedure. The function should only be called in response to the oob_data_request() callback provided that the legacy method is user pairing.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to 16 byte long TK array

simplesect.para: Zero on success or -EINVAL if NULL

memberdef.argsstring: (struct bt_conn *conn, const struct bt_le_oob_sc_data *oobd_local, const struct bt_le_oob_sc_data *oobd_remote)
memberdef.name: bt_le_oob_set_sc_data

briefdescription.para: Set OOB data during LE Secure Connections (SC) pairing procedure.

detaileddescription.para: This function allows to set OOB data during the LE SC pairing procedure. The function should only be called in response to the oob_data_request() callback provided that LE SC method is used for pairing.

The user should submit OOB data according to the information received in the callback. This may yield three different configurations: with only local OOB data present, with only remote OOB data present or with both local and remote OOB data present.

parameterdescription.para: Local OOB data or NULL if not present
Remote OOB data or NULL if not present

simplesect.para: Zero on success or error code otherwise, positive in case of protocol error or negative (POSIX) in case of stack internal error.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct bt_conn *conn, const struct bt_le_oob_sc_data **oobd_local, const struct bt_le_oob_sc_data **oobd_remote)
memberdef.name: bt_le_oob_get_sc_data

briefdescription.para: Get OOB data used for LE Secure Connections (SC) pairing procedure.

detaileddescription.para: This function allows to get OOB data during the LE SC pairing procedure that were set by the bt_le_oob_set_sc_data() API.

simplesect.para: The OOB data will only be available as long as the connection object associated with it is valid.

parameterdescription.para: Local OOB data or NULL if not set
Remote OOB data or NULL if not set

simplesect.para: Zero on success or error code otherwise, positive in case of protocol error or negative (POSIX) in case of stack internal error.

briefdescription.para: Set a fixed passkey to be used for pairing.

detaileddescription.para: This API is only available when the CONFIG_BT_FIXED_PASSKEY configuration option has been enabled.
Sets a fixed passkey to be used for pairing. If set, the pairing_confim() callback will be called for all incoming pairings.

parameterdescription.para: A valid passkey (0 - 999999) or BT_PASSKEY_INVALID to disable a previously set fixed passkey.

simplesect.para: 0 on success or a negative error code on failure.

briefdescription.para: Register authentication callbacks.

detaileddescription.para: Register callbacks to handle authenticated pairing. Passing NULL unregisters a previous callbacks structure.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or negative error code otherwise

briefdescription.para: Reply with entered passkey.

detaileddescription.para: This function should be called only after passkey_entry callback from bt_conn_auth_cb structure was called.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or negative error code otherwise

briefdescription.para: Cancel ongoing authenticated pairing.

detaileddescription.para: This function allows to cancel ongoing authenticated pairing.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or negative error code otherwise

briefdescription.para: Reply if passkey was confirmed to match by user.

detaileddescription.para: This function should be called only after passkey_confirm callback from bt_conn_auth_cb structure was called.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or negative error code otherwise

briefdescription.para: Reply if incoming pairing was confirmed by user.

detaileddescription.para: This function should be called only after pairing_confirm callback from bt_conn_auth_cb structure was called if user confirmed incoming pairing.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or negative error code otherwise

briefdescription.para: Reply with entered PIN code.

detaileddescription.para: This function should be called only after PIN code callback from bt_conn_auth_cb structure was called. It's for legacy 2.0 devices.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or negative error code otherwise

briefdescription.para: Initiate an BR/EDR connection to a remote device.

detaileddescription.para: Allows initiate new BR/EDR link to remote peer using its address.
The caller gets a new reference to the connection object which must be released with bt_conn_unref() once done using the object.

simplesect.para: Valid connection object on success or NULL otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Initiate an SCO connection to a remote device.

detaileddescription.para: Allows initiate new SCO link to remote peer using its address.
The caller gets a new reference to the connection object which must be released with bt_conn_unref() once done using the object.

simplesect.para: Valid connection object on success or NULL otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Bluetooth connection handling.
